title: 7-year-old grazed by bullet in south Kansas City
content:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) -
There has been more violence against children as a 7-year-old is grazed by a bullet in south Kansas City.
The shooting was the result of a family feud that escalated into a gun being fired in a home.
Neighbors said they didn't know the people who lived in the house in the 9100 block of Oak Street.
Greg Peterson lives next door.
"I've seen a couple children. They're very, very quiet. They don't say anything bad, don't say anything at all," Peterson said.
Police say an argument broke out in the home early Sunday morning. The child's father and his mother's ex-boyfriend began fighting. Someone fired a gun, an unusual occurrence in the quiet neighborhood.
"It's usually just like this, like it is right now. People walking up and down the street, lots of kids playing," neighbor Zach Mann said.
Neither Peterson nor anyone in the surrounding houses could recall hearing or seeing anything unusual.
"Didn't hear a thing. Didn't see a thing," Mann said.
This is yet another case of a child shot in Kansas City. People on the block can't believe it happened so close to home.
"It wasn't like this when I moved in. I'm really sick about it. My god, back in my day people might get in fights but there were no guns involved," said a neighbor who didn't want to be identified.
Fortunately, police say the bullet just grazed the child. He suffered only minor injuries. Police are looking for his father who they believe may have fired the shot.
"It's scary but it could happen in any neighborhood," Mann stated.
Neighbors and family members say they're upset but also realize the outcome could have been much worse.
